data.title: Simply Khmer is simply delicious
data.text: This is a good introduction to the wonders of Cambodian cuisine.  The wait staff is very friendly and helpful.  The restaurant is clean and nicely decorated.  The menu is extensive with lots of vegetarian options as well.  We loved the sticky chicken wings, which are addictive.  The beef with lemon grass was also delicious.

data.title: Really good food
data.text: We ate here on a weekday. It has a very small parking lot, but is surprisingly large inside. The food was outstanding. We had a variety of different dishes. Everyone was very happy with their choices.

data.title: Love this place!
data.text: Had never tried Cambodian food until about a year ago, but since going here have stopped in for lunch with my co-workers at least once a month. We have never been disappointed and we always try to sample at least one new plate each time. A few of my personal likes are the triple combo, which has really nice crispy wings with an awesome papaya salad and sticky rice, the Cha Kroung Sach Moun, which is chicken with lemon grass, garlic, jalapenos, basil, and other spices, and the Mee Ka-Tang Spicy, a combo of flat rice noodles and your choice of meat with many different vegetables. One of my newest favorites is Pleah-Sach Ko, which is thin slices of uncooked beef with lemon grass, asian eggplant, onions, bean sprouts, jalapenos, fish sauce, and lime juice. The combination sounds weird if you have not tried it, but I absolutely love it. Don't be turned off by the uncooked beef, as it cooks in the acidity of the lime juice, yet remains very tender. This plate has a very fresh bright taste to it. I should also mention that the staff seems pretty knowledgeable about the food, and can make recommendations if you don't know what to order. The menu is nicely descriptive with some pictures too.

data.title: menu has changed - still good
data.text: We went here thinking there would be a lot of vegetarian choices as there had been in the past; instead, we had to ask server what could be made without meat.  The veggie pad thai was very good and didn't disappoint, so I'll go back!

data.title: Simply Delicious
data.text:
My friend and I spent 2 months living in Cambodia and we were craving some authentic cuisine. We've tried a few places around Lowell that really haven't stood out and we have heard a lot of great things about this place. We were not disappointed. 
The menu itself is very large and is a little overwhelming, but in the best way possible. There are so many different options and each item has such a distinct, fresh and different flavor. 
After we finished our gigantic meal, we had to order some food TO GO as well, just because it was so delicious. If you're in the mood for some authentic Cambodian food, than this is one of the only places in Lowell I would recommend.

data.title: Go out of your way to eat here
data.text:
I found this restaurant by using an app that lets one see all the restaurants along ones route that were visited by a TV food show.  I set the parameters of the search with up to 10 mile detour. The meal here has made this my favorite app!

I had the hot wings.  OMG these were the crispiest wings I've ever had.  The sauce was similar to the Thai sweet chili sauce.  But the flavor was much better with a more pronounced flavor of fish sauce and more heat than typical.  I loved it.  Can I take it home and drink it?!

Then the Mee Ka-Tang Spicy with seafood.  There was squid, "crab," fish cake and shrimp with two fried eggs on top. This was a perfect noodle dish. It was spicy but had a subtle flavor to go with the heat.  I think it would have been a bit better with some more Chinese broccoli but still loved it.

data.title: Loved it!
data.text: I have driven by this place many times, never even thinking of stopping in and checking it out.  Located in a tatty mini-strip mall, I expected it to be a bit of a grimy hole in the wall.  But, It came highly recommended by a friend who enjoys Cambodian and Vietnamese food as I do; between us we have sampled many of the eateries in the area.  What a delightful find Simply Khmer is!  The inside is spacious and clean, a nice vibe with a fish tank, natural light, and bamboo.  The staff was very pleasant and the service was spot on.  On a weekday lunch, there were several tables occupied, and they  looked like weekly regulars.  And the food!  As first timers, we tried the Mee Ka-tang (a flat noodle dish) and Bai/Cha Kroung (ground meet with peppers and spices). Wow.  Utterly delicious, and perfectly spiced.  My companion and I smiled at each other a lot as we tucked into our lunch.  The menu is extensive, and I did not recognize a lot of the dishes, but will definitely be back to sample some more.  They do not have a take out menu per-se, but the entire menu is online and you can order up carry out from there. If you are new to Cambodian cuisine, just ask for suggestions and the wait staff will help you out. Definitely give this one a try.

data.title: Nice Change of Pace Asian Cuisine
data.text: This is the first Cambodian restaurant I ever tried. I checked out the reviews of a few of this type in the area and settled on this one.  Turned out to be a good choice.  Service was attentive. I started with an order of Nam Chow - a type of cold spring roll.  The veggies in the filling were crisp and fresh.  Chicken and shrimp were nicely spiced.  It came with a peanut sauce for dipping.  For my entree I had Som-law Ka Ko Khmer with chicken.  This was a nice stew with green papaya, Asian egg plant, string bean, pumpkin, Chinese broccoli and roasted rice.  The broth had a bright, complex flavor.  It came with a side of rice.  The restaurant is fairly spacious for sitting in a small strip mall.  Parking is sparse.  It's a BYOB (not mentioned on the website).  Menu offerings range in price from eat on the cheap options to moderately priced options.

data.title: Disappointed
data.text:
I had a long history of bad service with this place. To start with, you call in an order and show up half an hour later and they still have jot made the food and says it will take another half an hour. This occurred at least three times. And have occurred to many other people I know.  Secondly, when I eat in, the service gets even worst. On the most recent visit, my family and I went when it was slow, and only we were there and one another couple.  I waited 15 minutes and then just went to the register to order.  Secondly, they do not provide the condiments other traditional Khmer restaurant offers and even charge you for simple items such as soup broth on the side or dipping sauce.  Yes, the food is fine, but so are so many other locals Khmer restaurant in town.  As a Cambodian, you know the cost associates with making such food and when you are charged $2 for side soup , you are definitely gonna be disappointed at how they are trying to rip you off.  Warning to the non-asian people who are eating there...this place is a rip off. They are charging you for items they should not be.  If other restaurants can "keep their doors open" by providing these items free of charge then they have no excuse.  

With that said, many Lowell ppl have vowed to never go there again for good reason.  Go support other locals in the area...better service, and pricing.

data.title: Delicious  and affordable Khmer food
data.text:
I invited to this restaurant yesterday for lunch.  Impressive!  You are greeted very warmly by staff and seated promptly.  It is service with smile.  The server helped me with my choices and drinks from the cultural perspective also.   Food was delicious, plentiful and very affordable.

I will be back soon

data.title: New food for us.
data.text: We have never had Cambodian food before. If they could follow requests by fufilling them, I would have given them a higher rating. The food was very good. Would I go back? There are a LOT of restaurants around here to try. Yes, good, but I wouldn't go out of my way.

data.title: Why did I have to ask
data.text: Much bigger inside then it looks from the outside. Spacious, lots of room between tables. We ordered an appetizer and 3 entrees. When the appetizer came the waiter did not being the sauce with it that our cousin remembered. She asked and the waiter replied, "oh, we don't usually bring it unless asked." Hello? We had asked that green peppers in another dish be served on the side. These were served uncooked (!) we also asked that something be substituted for the imitation crab in another dish but nothing was. Still, the food tasted VERY good. It was nice and spicy but not overpowering.

data.title: Celebrated Cambodian New Year 4/15/15!
data.text: Beyond the word described, embarrassing and ashamed in front of my long distance relatives and friends whose comes visiting us for the New Year because of the poor service at Simply Khmer Restaurant. We have to asked for the service's...for people of 10, we shorts on everything...like soup bowls, plates, soup spoons, chop sticks, cups, cups of water, etc... they only gave us half of the stuffs of 7 adults not even include the 3 small children. Oh all of those stuffs are short because we ordered 2 large hotpot soup for dinner and another two side dishes. Long story short, the hotpot soup pot is burning up and you can smell the pot burning across the room and still no service/waitress come by to check up at our table, it's sad until I step up and told them about the situation and how their services to our table. One of the Asian waitress claim she were helping us all the times, but I've told her... yes you do help us after we called out for service. Anyway, from now this place are not going to be our favorite place again due to poor and rude services. Families members unsatisfied, sad, and our New Year celebration is kinda disappointed. Thanks to Simply Khmer Restaurant staff's.

data.title: Excellent food and service
data.text:
I went here for lunch. I got the Nam Chow appetizer (fresh rolls with ground chicken and whole shrimp) and the Bai/Cha Kroung with chicken (Chicken Lemongrass with steamed rice combo). They asked me if I wanted it spicy. I said yes because I really like spicy food.  It was not as spicy as I thought it would be when I got it - but definitely had a bit of kick to it.

The food was awesome. Absolutely delicious. The best lemongrass chicken I have had in a long while. The fresh rolls (two come in an order) were also among the best I have had.

Service was very fast (was able to order quickly, the food came quickly and got my bill promptly afterwards). Server was very polite and helpful when I asked questions about offering on the menu.

The decor is simple, and the place is very clean.

I can highly recommend Simply Khmer without hesitation.

Note: Their hours are changing a bit. Starting next month they will not be open on Mondays anymore.

data.title: Simply Simple
data.text: I know it's a haunt of many locals but it's not the best of the Cambodian restaurants just slightly more expensive.  The food is wholesome and good, but not that special.  Portions are good, service is iffy.

data.title: Great little ethnic restaurant in Lowell
data.text:
Lowell Massachusetts is known for their large South East Asian population.  If you are looking to try something a bit more exotic than Chinese or Thai, visit Simply Khmer.  The place is neat and clean, reassuring for folks who may not want to venture into little hole-in-the wall restaurants.  There is some parking right in front of the strip mall, and more on the street.  I most often visit at lunch time, where it is no problem to be in and out in 45 minutes.

The Mee Ka-Tang Spicy Special noodles with chicken is my go to dish when work colleagues go for lunch.
The pineapple fried rice is really good, it doesn't seem exotic or anything, but any time I go with a group we order it and there isn't any leftover.
The Amok Trey, fish served in bamboo leaves is great.  Not spicy, but very flavorful.

data.title: 2nd chance required
data.text:
I was looking for an authentic Cambodian restaurant in Lowell and Simply Khmer seemed to fit the bill. Regarding the food, I felt we (two people) didn't give the menu a fair chance. We ordered on the safe side, not wanting too spicey or anything too unusual, this being our first time. As such, our meal was tasty, but seemed average. The eggroll appetizers were yummy and the spring rolls were very fresh. I did not enjoy the papaya salad, but I did enjoy the Amok Trey, ("boneless Talapia fish, coconut milk, lemon grass, shallots, kaffir lime leaves, broccoli leaves and served in banana leaves; Amok trey is a traditional dish of Cambodian cooking"). My husband got a beef with asian broccoli.
Regarding the service: I had called early in the day and was told the restaurant does not take reservations for two. I explained we had theater tickets and would like to come when we could easily be seated; we were told 6:30. Unfortunately this was bad advice and the restaurant was filling up quickly and had lots of parties with reservations. We were anxious to be seated or we were going to leave. The woman in charge made every effort to accomodate us and managed to seat us. The staff was young and I think they could have had one or two more people for service.
By the time we left, the restaurant was croweded with people waiting. All types of people were there, so I think this restaurant has broad appeal. We plan to go back again to give the food a second chance!

data.title: Alright place
data.text: This place is an average. We asked the waitress for a few things and said that they can't do it. I wonder want they can do. Yes it's authentic but to get what you want won't happen here. Price is kind of expensive.

data.title: Not great!
data.text:
The phom phen (both rice and egg noodle soup) was rather salty.  Taste rather spoiled! We ate there at around 1030 in the morning. Soup was probably leftover from yesterday
Indeed the soup was spoiled.  I had the runs all day!
Fried rice was hard.  Beef Luc Lac (beef steak) was hard in texture.

data.title: Authentic cuisine
data.text: Just like grandma made! If your grandma was Cambodian! Featured on the Food Network, this is a Must-visit when in Lowell. It's small and simple but all that matters is the food.
